pullRequest.title: [FLINK-15938][table-planner-blink] Enable state cleanup in background…
pullRequest.bodyText:
… for Streaming[SemiAnti]JoinOperator in blink

What is the purpose of the change
This pr enables state cleanup in background for Streaming[SemiAnti]JoinOperator in blink.
Default state cleanup in background has been enabled after 1.10, so this only affects 1.9.X.
Brief change log
Add cleanupInBackground to StateTtlConfig in JoinRecordStateViews.
Verifying this change
This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.
Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): (yes / no)
The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with @Public(Evolving): (yes / no)
The serializers: (yes / no / don't know)
The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): (yes / no / don't know)
Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: (yes / no / don't know)
The S3 file system connector: (yes / no / don't know)

Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (yes / no)
If yes, how is the feature documented? (not applicable / docs / JavaDocs / not documented)

nodes.bodyText:
cleanupInBackground() is enabled by default and this method is deprecated. Do we need to add this in master?
From my understanding, we only need to update 1.9 branch.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,7 @@ static StateTtlConfig createTtlConfig(long retentionTime, boolean stateCleaningE
 				.newBuilder(Time.milliseconds(retentionTime))
 				.setUpdateType(StateTtlConfig.UpdateType.OnCreateAndWrite)
 				.setStateVisibility(StateTtlConfig.StateVisibility.ReturnExpiredIfNotCleanedUp)
+				.cleanupInBackground()
